sources.title: Porky's Preview (1941)
sources.description: Porky’s Preview is a Warner Bros. Looney Tunes cartoon directed by Tex Avery. The short was released on April 19, 1941, and stars Porky Pig. Watch on RetroFlix.org:  https://retroflix.org/porkys-preview-1941/

sources.title: Porky's Preview (1941)
sources.description: The audience enters Porky’s movie theater, with a collection of quick gags.

metadata.Plot: The audience enters Porky's movie theater, with a collection of quick gags: A firefly acting as usher, a kangaroo taking tickets and putting the stubs in her pouch, a chicken buying child tickets for her eggs. A skunk tries to buy a ticket, costing a nickel, but he only has one scent. He looks for a way to sneak in. Meanwhile, Porky introduces the show: a collection of cartoons, drawn as stick figures. At the end, the audience is all gone because the skunk managed to sneak in. Porky's cartoons include: Circus Parade, Choo-Choo Train, Soldiers (Marchin), Horse Race, and Dances (hula, Mexican hat, and ballet). All accompanied by a self-parody musical score.
metadata.Actors: Mel Blanc, Sara Berner, Cliff Nazarro
